modules.title: Intro to Sustainable Energy for Development
modules.description: Module 1 offers an overview of sustainable energy within the global development agenda, linking it to challenges like climate change and energy poverty, and opportunities for economic growth and energy security. It introduces SDG7, its progress, and interlinkages, while presenting UNDP’s Energy Moonshot and the Sustainable Energy Academy’s tools for accelerating energy transitions.

chapters.title: Chapter 1: Introduction to Energy Systems
chapters.description: This chapter explores global energy flows, the energy trilemma, and the urgent need for a sustainable transition to meet climate and development goals.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Introduction to the Energy for Development pathway
Lesson 3: The Path to Achieving Universal Energy Access by 2030

chapters.title: Chapter 2: Interlinkages between Energy and Other SDGs
chapters.description: This chapter explores SDG interlinkages, emphasizing integrated, context-specific energy solutions that maximize synergies, minimize trade-offs, and advance multiple development goals.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Access to electricity and clean cooking (SDG 7.1)

chapters.title: Chapter 3: Regional Perspective
chapters.description: This chapter describes approaches and methods currently being applied - within the UN system and beyond - to uncover system interconnections, policy coherence and strengthen integration across the SDGs.

chapters.title: Chapter 4: The Sustainable Energy Academy
chapters.description: This chapter highlights UNDP’s role in advancing sustainable energy for development and accelerating energy transition through its Strategic Plan and the Sustainable Energy Academy initiative.

chapters.title: Module 1 Outro
chapters.description: Module 1 offers an overview of sustainable energy within the global development agenda, linking it to challenges like climate change and energy poverty, and opportunities for economic growth and energy security. It introduces SDG7, its progress, and interlinkages, while presenting UNDP’s Energy Moonshot and the Sustainable Energy Academy’s tools for accelerating energy transitions.

modules.title: Energy Access and Inclusive Energy Services
modules.description: Module 2 explores energy access and inclusive energy services as fundamental human rights and essential to social progress, economic growth, and development. It addresses persistent global gaps—where 685 million lack access—and highlights how the sustainable energy transition can correct imbalances, improve lives, and deliver equitable, safe, and affordable energy for all.

chapters.title: Chapter 1: Topic Overview and Background
chapters.description: This chapter explores energy access as a human right and a catalyst for unlocking development opportunities, examines energy poverty, and presents solutions to advance equitable, inclusive, and sustainable energy.

chapters.title: Chapter 2: Current Status, Trends and Barriers to Energy Access
chapters.description: This chapter analyzes global energy access disparities, highlighting barriers, trends, and solutions to improve access for underserved and marginalized populations.

chapters.title: Chapter 3: Bridging the Energy Access Gap
chapters.description: This chapter guides building energy systems centered on well-being, justice, and sustainability, emphasizing innovation, inclusivity, partnerships, and community-led solutions.

chapters.title: Module 2 Outro
chapters.description: Module 2 explores energy access and inclusive energy services as fundamental human rights and essential to social progress, economic growth, and development. It addresses persistent global gaps—where 685 million lack access—and highlights how the sustainable energy transition can correct imbalances, improve lives, and deliver equitable, safe, and affordable energy for all.

modules.title: Just Energy Transition
modules.description: Module 3 explores the Just Energy Transition, emphasizing equity, justice, and inclusion in the shift to sustainable energy. It addresses social and environmental challenges, promotes locally tailored solutions, and highlights the need for community-led action, worker support, and economic diversification to ensure no one is left behind in the transition.

chapters.title: Chapter 1: Introduction to the Energy Transition Landscape
chapters.description: This chapter introduces the just energy transition, highlighting its social, gender, and ethical dimensions beyond decarbonization, and explores practical applications.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Unpacking The Concept Of A Just Energy Transition
Lesson 3: Key Challenges In The Global South

chapters.title: Chapter 2: Ensuring a Just Transition for Workers and Affected Communities
chapters.description: This chapter explores strategies to support workers and communities, ensuring equity, inclusion, and ethical practices in the sustainable energy transition.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: Social Safety Nets and Income Support
Lesson 4: Community-led sustainable energy projects and community-based solutions

chapters.title: Chapter 3: A JET that Preserves Nature and Catalyzes Economic Growth
chapters.description: This chapter explores critical minerals’ role in energy transition, highlighting sustainability challenges, global inequalities, and the need for responsible extraction.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Environmental Concerns of Clean Energy Technology Deployment

chapters.title: Chapter 4: Strategic Governance and Partnership Models for Just Energy Transitions
chapters.description: This chapter highlights governance and partnerships as key to just transitions, emphasizing equity, foresight, inclusive planning, and innovative financing like JETPs.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Governance Strategies for a Just Energy Transition
Lesson 2: Importance of Proactive Planning and Strategic Foresight

chapters.title: Module 3 Outro
chapters.description: Module 3 explores the Just Energy Transition, emphasizing equity, justice, and inclusion in the shift to sustainable energy. It addresses social and environmental challenges, promotes locally tailored solutions, and highlights the need for community-led action, worker support, and economic diversification to ensure no one is left behind in the transition.

modules.title: Sustainable Energy Finance
modules.description: Module 4 explores financial and market strategies driving the global energy transition, especially in developing countries. It examines public-private investments, innovative financing, and market dynamics, while addressing barriers like regulatory hurdles and risks. It also emphasizes energy finance’s broader development impacts—including gender, social, governance, and environmental dimensions—and practical solutions for scaling investment.

chapters.title: Chapter 1: Introduction to Sustainable Energy Finance and Market Dynamics
chapters.description: This chapter explores sustainable energy finance, market dynamics, ESG factors, and investment challenges in aligning capital with global energy transition goals.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: The Global Energy Investment Landscape of Energy Investments
Lesson 3: An Overview of Sustainable Energy Market Dynamics

chapters.title: Chapter 2: Public Sector and Sustainable Energy Finance
chapters.description: This chapter highlights how public investments, policies, and incentives catalyze private capital to drive sustainable energy transitions, especially in underserved regions.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Role of Public Sector in Sustainable Energy Finance

chapters.title: Chapter 3: Scaling Up Private Sector Investment in Sustainable Energy
chapters.description: This chapter emphasizes private sector’s vital role in energy transition, outlining strategies, tools, and partnerships to overcome investment barriers and risks.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Private Sector Investment in Sustainable Energy

chapters.title: Chapter 4: Innovative Financial Instruments and Tools for Renewable Energy
chapters.description: This chapter explores innovative financial tools—blended finance, bonds, swaps, carbon finance—that reduce risks and mobilize capital for renewables.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: Emerging Technologies: AI-Powered and Digital Financing Solutions

chapters.title: Chapter 5: Cross-Sectional Issues in Sustainable Energy Finance
chapters.description: This chapter highlights partnerships, gender integration, and regional priorities as key to inclusive, equitable, and effective sustainable energy finance solutions.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Gender Equality And Sustainable Energy Finance

chapters.title: Module 4 Outro
chapters.description: Module 4 explores financial and market strategies driving the global energy transition, especially in developing countries. It examines public-private investments, innovative financing, and market dynamics, while addressing barriers like regulatory hurdles and risks. It also emphasizes energy finance’s broader development impacts—including gender, social, governance, and environmental dimensions—and practical solutions for scaling investment.

modules.title: Energy Governance for a Just Energy Transition
modules.description: Module 5 examines energy governance as a catalyst for a just energy transition, highlighting inclusive institutions, legal frameworks, civic engagement, and oversight. It introduces people-centered, adaptable, digital, and multi-level governance approaches, offering tools and case studies to enhance transparency, policy coherence, and accountability for equitable and sustainable energy transformation.

chapters.title: Chapter 1: An Overview of Energy Governance
chapters.description: This chapter introduces energy governance principles and frameworks essential for guiding just energy transition while addressing economic, social, and environmental inequalities.

chapters.title: Chapter 2: Policy and Regulatory Frameworks for a Just Energy Transition
chapters.description: This chapter examines policy and regulatory frameworks that enable just energy transitions through coherence, adaptability, stakeholder engagement, and investment de-risking.

chapters.title: Chapter 3: Inclusive and Effective Institutions
chapters.description: Inclusive and effective institutions are the cornerstone of robust governance systems, ensuring coordinated efforts for a just energy transition. This section explores the roles of key actors, multi-level governance, and the importance of transparency, trust, and anti-corruption measures in energy governance.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Integrated Governance for a Just Energy Transition
Lesson 2: Transparency, Public Confidence, and Trust in Institutions

chapters.title: Chapter 4: Civic Engagement and Empowerment
chapters.description: This chapter highlights independent, agile oversight in energy governance to ensure transparency, gender equality, accountability, and adaptability in just energy transition.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Civic Engagements And Its Role in Energy Governance
Lesson 2: Facilitating Cooperation with a Heterogeneous Civil Society
Lesson 3: Gender Lens Oversight and Gender Audits in the Energy Transition

chapters.title: Module 5 Outro
chapters.description: Module 5 examines energy governance as a catalyst for a just energy transition, highlighting inclusive institutions, legal frameworks, civic engagement, and oversight. It introduces people-centered, adaptable, digital, and multi-level governance approaches, offering tools and case studies to enhance transparency, policy coherence, and accountability for equitable and sustainable energy transformation.

modules.title: The Climate Change-Energy Nexus
modules.description: Module 6 explores the deep link between energy systems and climate change, emphasizing the urgent need to shift to zero-carbon energy. It addresses emissions, climate risks to infrastructure, and adaptive solutions like resilient grids and renewables—highlighting their transformative role in building climate resilience and securing a sustainable energy future.

chapters.title: Chapter 1: Linkages between Energy Systems and Climate Change
chapters.description: This chapter examines how energy systems drive and are impacted by climate change, emphasizing decarbonization, sustainable practices, and adaptive energy strategies.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: The Impact of Energy Systems on Climate Change
Lesson 2: The Impact of Climate Change on Energy Systems

chapters.title: Chapter 2: Sustainable Energy for Climate Mitigation
chapters.description: This chapter highlights renewable energy’s role in climate mitigation, emphasizing its low emissions, health and economic benefits, and alignment with global goals.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: The Climate, Environmental and Health Benefits of Sustainable Energy
Lesson 2: Exploring Renewable Technologies for Climate Mitigation

chapters.title: Chapter 3: Sustainable Energy for Climate Adaptation
chapters.description: This chapter explores how sustainable energy supports climate adaptation through resilience-building, decentralized systems, inclusive planning, and strategies addressing vulnerable communities and infrastructure.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Renewable Energy for Enhancing Climate Resilience
Lesson 2: Enhancing Resilience and Adaptability of Energy Systems
Lesson 3: An Intersectional Approach to Climate Change

chapters.title: Chapter 4: Sustainable Energy Transformation in End-use Sectors
chapters.description: This chapter highlights electrification's role in decarbonizing sectors, emphasizing renewable integration, technological innovation, and policy action to meet climate goals.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Sustainable Buildings: Efficiency, Electrification, and Equity
Lesson 3: Transforming Transport: Electrification and Inclusive Mobility

chapters.title: Module 6 Outro
chapters.description: Module 6 explores the deep link between energy systems and climate change, emphasizing the urgent need to shift to zero-carbon energy. It addresses emissions, climate risks to infrastructure, and adaptive solutions like resilient grids and renewables—highlighting their transformative role in building climate resilience and securing a sustainable energy future.

modules.title: Data in Sustainable Energy
modules.description: Module 7 offers a in-depth introduction to the role of energy data in planning, monitoring, and evaluation for sustainable energy development. It emphasizes the importance of reliable, ethical data for achieving SDG7, explores standardized frameworks, key indicators, and challenges, and introduces innovative tools like AI and energy modeling for informed policymaking.

chapters.title: Chapter 1: Foundational Concepts of Energy Data and Its Role in Sustainability and Equity
chapters.description: This chapter explores how data supports equitable energy transitions, emphasizing policy impact, sustainability, and the need for strong digital governance frameworks.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: The Role of Data in Advancing Sustainable Energy And Equity

chapters.title: Chapter 2: Approaches to Planning, Monitoring, and Evaluation in Sustainable Energy
chapters.description: This chapter explores planning, monitoring, and evaluation frameworks that align energy projects with sustainability goals through inclusive, data-driven, and gender-responsive strategies.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Strategic Energy Planning at The Policy Level
Lesson 2: Fundamentals of Project Planning, Monitoring, and Evaluation
Lesson 3: Gender and Intersectionality in Energy Data and Planning

chapters.title: Chapter 3: Tools and Techniques for Data-Driven Insights in Energy
chapters.description: This chapter highlights data science, AI, and energy modelling tools for analysis, planning, and decision-making in sustainable energy systems.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Data Science Techniques for Energy Analysis

chapters.title: Chapter 4: Future Directions for Data in the Energy Sector
chapters.description: This chapter explores how AI and data science optimize energy systems, improve efficiency, manage renewables, and support digital energy transformation.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Emerging Trends and Technologies in Energy

chapters.title: Module 7 Outro
chapters.description: Module 7 offers a in-depth introduction to the role of energy data in planning, monitoring, and evaluation for sustainable energy development. It emphasizes the importance of reliable, ethical data for achieving SDG7, explores standardized frameworks, key indicators, and challenges, and introduces innovative tools like AI and energy modeling for informed policymaking.

modules.title: Shade
modules.description: Module 8 explores future energy trends and projections, emphasizing the creation of enabling environments for innovation. It highlights the role of partnerships, collaboration, and inclusive practices in driving sustainable energy transitions. Learners will gain tools to foster innovation ecosystems and lead transformative change across the global energy landscape.

chapters.title: Chapter 1: Future Trends and Projections
chapters.description: The chapter introduces renewable energy, its benefits, challenges, technologies, and role of data in supporting a just, inclusive global energy transition.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Key Drivers of Future Energy Demand and System Transformation
Lesson 2: The Changing Landscape of Energy Supply: Resources, Markets, and Policies
Lesson 3: Challenges, Tipping Points and Solutions in Renewable Energy

chapters.title: Chapter 2: Creating an Enabling Environment for an Innovation-Driven Energy Transition
chapters.description: This chapter examines key renewable energy technologies, their innovations, benefits, and challenges in driving a diverse, low-carbon, and sustainable future.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Policy and Market Mechanisms for Innovation
Lesson 2: The Role of Emerging Sectors in Future Energy Systems
Lesson 3: Intersectionality as a Framework for Innovation in Energy
Lesson 4: Critical Transformations for the Energy Transition

chapters.title: Chapter 3: Action
chapters.description: This chapter explores some innovations—decentralized systems, energy storage, and circular economy—that enhance resilience, access, and sustainability in the energy transition.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Actionable Steps Toward a Sustainable Energy Future
Lesson 3: Closing key messages and call to action

chapters.title: Module 8 Outro
chapters.description: Module 8 explores future energy trends and projections, emphasizing the creation of enabling environments for innovation. It highlights the role of partnerships, collaboration, and inclusive practices in driving sustainable energy transitions. Learners will gain tools to foster innovation ecosystems and lead transformative change across the global energy landscape.
